James

TextBody:
James,

Thank you for your time today.

On this meeting we tested your configuration and ensured proper setup of the tags. We've yet to see the results, as there seems to be a discrepancy between set tags and resolved tags. We're continuing the investigation. Please follow the recommendation of restarting the server and checking the job results again and update us.

Current issue: The table we're getting the data from is not getting updated no matter what we do.

Best wishes,
Ilya Kotov
Technical Support Engineer

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000FG8Ve:ref

Hello

I had a look through the job config while I was waiting for some changes to take effect last night and found what I think is the solution to my problem.

In the analysis, the temp table seems to be configured from the SQL ScriptEditor page -  “edit table”  and by changing the values in there I was able to get the job to do what I need  (except it only seems to create a tag  called SENSITIVE).

I think it now works because the config was looking for a file called newdata2.csv and the criteria I choose are in newdata1.csv (as I have shown you).  I changed the filename to newdata1.csv and now it works.


[cid:image007.png@01DB34DF.509AB870]

I will try and find out how to set the tag to something else apart from SENSITIVE  which is not sufficient for our needs and I will let you know how I get on and if I need help.

James

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000FG8Ve:ref



Hello

 

I had a look through the job config while I was waiting for some changes to take effect last night and found what I think is the solution to my problem.

 

In the analysis, the temp table seems to be configured from the SQL ScriptEditor page -  “edit table”  and by changing the values in there I was able to get the job to do what I need  (except it only seems to create a tag  called SENSITIVE).

 

I think it now works because the config was looking for a file called newdata2.csv and the criteria I choose are in newdata1.csv (as I have shown you).  I changed the filename to newdata1.csv and now it works.  

 

 



 

I will try and find out how to set the tag to something else apart from SENSITIVE  which is not sufficient for our needs and I will let you know how I get on and if I need help.

 

James

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000FG8Ve:ref

 


Hello

 

I had a look through the job config while I was waiting for some changes to take effect last night and found what I think is the solution to my problem.

 

In the analysis, the temp table seems to be configured from the SQL ScriptEditor page -  “edit table”  and by changing the values in there I was able to get the job to do what I need  (except it only seems to create a tag  called SENSITIVE).

 

I think it now works because the config was looking for a file called newdata2.csv and the criteria I choose are in newdata1.csv (as I have shown you).  I changed the filename to newdata1.csv and now it works.  

 

 



 

I will try and find out how to set the tag to something else apart from SENSITIVE  which is not sufficient for our needs and I will let you know how I get on and if I need help.

 

James

Hello

 

I had a look through the job config while I was waiting for some changes to take effect last night and found what I think is the solution to my problem.

 

In the analysis, the temp table seems to be configured from the SQL ScriptEditor page -  “edit table”  and by changing the values in there I was able to get the job to do what I need  (except it only seems to create a tag  called SENSITIVE).

 

I think it now works because the config was looking for a file called newdata2.csv and the criteria I choose are in newdata1.csv (as I have shown you).  I changed the filename to newdata1.csv and now it works.  

 

 



 

I will try and find out how to set the tag to something else apart from SENSITIVE  which is not sufficient for our needs and I will let you know how I get on and if I need help.

 

James

Hello Ilya

I am making progress but it seems whatever is trying to write the tags (and indeed read them from files during the scan does not have the right permissions.

I see this in the action log:

16:17:11.371499 Debug Tag Type is: 1
16:17:11.381526 Debug Error reading core properties from file
16:17:11.382529 Debug Failed to get tags of '\S-UKAPRE-EFR01PN$DATADepartmentsITNew Microsoft Word Document.docx'. Error: The system cannot open the device or file specified

16:17:11.384534 Debug Tag Type is: 1

[cid:image010.png@01DB35A6.B2528F80]

James

TextBody:
James,

You need to ensure that these files can be read AND modified (for metadata alteration purposes) by the service account in use. This can be checked with Effective Access feature of the file's Security settings.

As for permissions please check these articles: 
https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EnterpriseAuditor_11.6/page/Content/Config/WindowsFile/Overview.htm

https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EnterpriseAuditor_11.6/page/Content/Config/WindowsFile/Access.htm

But do you have any idea why we get 3 million file access errors on FSAA  job now?

 



 

My assumption is that enabling File tag metadata collection in the FSAA job would only require read access – the same as it already has for discovering keywords in the file?  Maybe that’s not right?

From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
Sent: Wednesday, November 13, 2024 10:45 AM

Subject: RE: Automatic reply: Netwrix Support Ticket #419843 - Action Module - file tag [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0FG8Ve:ref ]



 

James,

You need to ensure that these files can be read AND modified (for metadata alteration purposes) by the service account in use. This can be checked with Effective Access feature of the file's Security settings.

As for permissions please check these articles: 
https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EnterpriseAuditor_11.6/page/Content/Config/WindowsFile/Overview.htm

https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EnterpriseAuditor_11.6/page/Content/Config/WindowsFile/Access.htm

Hello

 

I had a look through the job config while I was waiting for some changes to take effect last night and found what I think is the solution to my problem.

 

In the analysis, the temp table seems to be configured from the SQL ScriptEditor page -  “edit table”  and by changing the values in there I was able to get the job to do what I need  (except it only seems to create a tag  called SENSITIVE).

 

I think it now works because the config was looking for a file called newdata2.csv and the criteria I choose are in newdata1.csv (as I have shown you).  I changed the filename to newdata1.csv and now it works.  

 

 



 

I will try and find out how to set the tag to something else apart from SENSITIVE  which is not sufficient for our needs and I will let you know how I get on and if I need help.

 

James

James,

You need to ensure that these files can be read AND modified (for metadata alteration purposes) by the service account in use. This can be checked with Effective Access feature of the file's Security settings.

As for permissions please check these articles:

Hello

I had a look through the job config while I was waiting for some changes to take effect last night and found what I think is the solution to my problem.

In the analysis, the temp table seems to be configured from the SQL ScriptEditor page -  “edit table”  and by changing the values in there I was able to get the job to do what I need  (except it only seems to create a tag  called SENSITIVE).

I think it now works because the config was looking for a file called newdata2.csv and the criteria I choose are in newdata1.csv (as I have shown you).  I changed the filename to newdata1.csv and now it works.


[cid:image005.png@01DB35C4.181B0E10]

TextBody:
James,

They both state generally the same required permissions:
 
The Netwrix Activity Monitor must have an Activity Agent deployed on the Windows file server to be monitored. While actively monitoring, the Activity Agent generates activity log files stored on the server. The credential used to deploy the Activity Agent must have the following permissions on the server:


	
	Membership in the local Administrators group
	
	
	READ and WRITE access to the archive location for Archiving feature only
	


It is also necessary to enable the Remote Registry Service on the Activity Agent server.

For integration between the Activity Monitor and Enterprise Auditor, the credential used by Enterprise Auditor to read the activity log files must have also have this permission

Please attach the screenshots of one of the files affected with it's Effective Access permissions visible.

Thank you,
Ilya Kotov
Technical Support Engineer
1-949-407-5125 x7099

As for permissions please check these articles:

James,

They both state generally the same required permissions:


The Netwrix Activity Monitor must have an Activity Agent deployed on the Windows file server to be monitored. While actively monitoring, the Activity Agent generates activity log files stored on the server. The credential used to deploy the Activity Agent must have the following permissions on the server:

  *   Membership in the local Administrators group
  *   READ and WRITE access to the archive location for Archiving feature only

It is also necessary to enable the Remote Registry Service on the Activity Agent server.

For integration between the Activity Monitor and Enterprise Auditor, the credential used by Enterprise Auditor to read the activity log files must have also have this permission

Please attach the screenshots of one of the files affected with it's Effective Access permissions visible.

Thank you,
Ilya Kotov

Subject: RE: Automatic reply: Netwrix Support Ticket #419843 - Action Module - file tag [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0FG8Ve:ref ]



 

James,

They both state generally the same required permissions:
 

The Netwrix Activity Monitor must have an Activity Agent deployed on the Windows file server to be monitored. While actively monitoring, the Activity Agent generates activity log files stored on the server. The credential used to deploy the Activity Agent must have the following permissions on the server:


	Membership in the local Administrators group
	READ and WRITE access to the archive location for Archiving feature only


It is also necessary to enable the Remote Registry Service on the Activity Agent server.

For integration between the Activity Monitor and Enterprise Auditor, the credential used by Enterprise Auditor to read the activity log files must have also have this permission

Please attach the screenshots of one of the files affected with it's Effective Access permissions visible.

Thank you,
Ilya Kotov
Technical Support Engineer
